New Records: Shohei Ohtani moved closer to becoming the first player in major league history with 50 homers and 50 stolen bases in a season.
Key Match Events: Gavin Lux singled in the go-ahead run with two outs in the seventh inning.
Shohei Ohtani hit his 47th home run and stole his 48th base.
Tommy Edman homered from both sides of the plate in the same game.
Michael Kopech loaded the bases on consecutive walks in the ninth inning.
Isaac Paredes' sacrifice fly cut Chicago’s deficit to 10-8.
Suzuki was thrown out trying to steal third and Michael Busch struck out swinging to end the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Max Muncy commented on the team's resilience, stating 'We had guys battling up there and it was good to see everyone not giving up.'
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts praised Tommy Edman, saying 'Tommy is otherworldly these days.'
Shohei Ohtani's performance was highlighted by Max Muncy, who said, 'Every night I feel like he does something that we haven’t seen.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers' magic number to clinch the division dropped to 11 after San Diego lost at Seattle.
The Cubs outscored the Dodgers 16-7 in winning the first two games and took the season series, 4-2.
The Dodgers walked 10 batters, including four by starter Bobby Miller.
Bobby Miller's ERA ballooned to 8.17 after giving up six runs in 4 1/3 innings.
Others: Cubs' RHP Porter Hodge saw a doctor after experiencing a racing heartbeat and was cleared.
Cubs' LHP Justin Steele (tendinitis) threw a bullpen session and will do another one this weekend in Colorado.
Dodgers' RHP Tyler Glasnow (tendinitis) will throw at least two innings during a simulated game Friday in Atlanta.
Dodgers' RHP Joe Kelly (shoulder inflammation) will pitch Thursday and Sunday for Triple-A Oklahoma City before rejoining the team next week.
